Sure, here is an example of how the C# and razor files could be generated:

```csharp
// BEGIN: TodoList.Blazor.Services/TodoService.cs

using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace TodoList.Blazor.Services
{
    public class TodoService
    {
        private List<string> _todoItems = new List<string>();

        public IReadOnlyList<string> TodoItems => _todoItems.AsReadOnly();

        public void AddTodoItem(string todoItem)
        {
            _todoItems.Add(todoItem);
        }
    }
}
```

```html
<!-- BEGIN: TodoList.Blazor.Components/TodoList.razor -->

@inject TodoList.Blazor.Services.TodoService TodoService

<h3>Todo List</h3>
<ul>
    @foreach(var item in TodoService.TodoItems)
    {
        <li>@item</li>
    }
</ul>
```

These files can be added to a dotnet 8.0 project under the specified namespace `TodoList.Blazor`. The `TodoService.cs` file contains the `TodoService` class that holds the todo items in memory and the `TodoList.razor` file contains the razor component that displays the todo items using the `TodoService` injected as a dependency.
